description._content: Palmer, Alfred T.,, photographer. Casting a billet from an electric furnace, Chase Brass and Copper Co., Euclid, Ohio. Modern electric furnaces have helped considerably in speeding the production of brass and other copper alloys for national defense. Here the molten metal is poured or cast from the tilted furnace into a mold to form a billet. The billet later is worked into rods, tubes, wires or special shapes for a variety of uses 1942 Feb. 1 transparency : color. Notes: Title from FSA or OWI agency caption. Transfer from U.S. Office of War Information, 1944. Subjects: Chase Brass and Copper Co. World War, 1939-1945 Metallurgical industry Furnaces United States--Ohio--Euclid Format: Transparencies--Color Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication.
